content.title: The indigenous community protecting Himalayan sacred cattle in India
content.description: The mithun, an endangered species in the Himalayas, are threatened by deforestation and climate change, so farmers are building "living fences" to protect them.

blocks.altText: Oyem Ering, an indigenous farmer strokes a mithun in Mirem, Arunachal Pradesh, India (Credit: Millo Ankha)

content.title: How Olympic windsurfers are fighting invasive alien species
content.description: Invasive non-native species are thriving, but some Olympic sailors, windsurfers and rowers are helping to combat this destructive flora and fauna.

blocks.altText: Alice Read reaches for the water as she windsurfs (Credit: Max Miechowski)

content.title: The Kenyan enthralled by the healing power of plants
content.description: Kenyan Martin Odhiambo cultivates medicinal plants and hopes that remedies can one day be regulated.

blocks.altText: Man looking at the stalk of a plant

content.title: Future Earth: Sign up to our newsletter
content.description: Essential climate news and hopeful developments across the globe, every Tuesday in your inbox.

blocks.altText: Future Earth: Sign up to our newsletter

content.title: Festivals should ditch diesel - Ecotricity boss
content.description: The Stroud-based company helps WOMAD power one of its stages with batteries charged by green energy.

blocks.altText: People walking past, climbing on and gathering around a colourful Womad sign

content.title: Will wet summers continue in NI?
content.description: Climate change does not mean Mediterranean weather will shift northwards, Cecilia Daly says.

blocks.altText: A woman with an umbrella by the sea - stock photo

content.title: Something in the water? Why we love shark films
content.description: From the Steven Spielberg classic Jaws, to predators stalking the Seine in Under Paris, there is no shortage of shark films.

blocks.altText: A woman in the water holding a knife, and looking to her right

content.title: Haunting portrait of young storm victim wins photo award
content.description: The Mangrove Photography Awards entries capture unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

blocks.altText: A girl stands in front of her tea shop, which has been destroyed by the sea during a storm, in Frazerganj, Sundarbans, India

content.title: First images of Jasper after 100m high wildfire hit
content.description: The fierce wildfire in the Canadian town of Jasper melted cars to the road and turned homes to ash.

blocks.altText: A general view of burnt buses and cars in Jasper, Alta., on Friday, July 26, 2024

content.title: The ancient Mexican techniques to save water
content.description: As water scarcity threatens their livelihoods, indigenous women in Mexico are relearning how to grow their ancestral foods.

blocks.altText: Agustina Ortiz, stands beside her 20,000-liter ferrocement tank at her home in the community of Xixovo, Oaxaca, on 5 December 2023 (Credit: Stephania Corpi Arnaud)

content.title: New wetlands are cleaning the UK's sewage-infested rivers
content.description: As effluent from sewage works and agricultural pollution flow freely into rivers, researchers and local citizens are urgently seeking to clean up the UK's waterways.

blocks.altText: The edge of a riverbank (Credit: Getty Images)

content.title: How climate chaos is threatening the real 'Paddington bear'
content.description: Drought forces the real Paddington Bear into deadly conflict with cattle farmers in the Andes.

blocks.altText: Saving the real 'Paddington Bear' in Bolivia

content.title: How electric vehicles could improve our mental health
content.description: Noise and air pollution are major threats and EVs can therefore offer a promising solution.

blocks.altText: How electric vehicles could improve our mental health

content.title: How greening our cities can reduce heat stress
content.description: Heat is the most deadly extreme weather phenomenon and cities are seeking ways to cool their urban cores.

blocks.altText: How greening our cities can reduce heat stress

content.title: Tidal kites: New technology harnessing ocean energy
content.description: These mechanical creatures lurk beneath the water's surface and power homes in the Faroe Islands.

blocks.altText: Tidal kites: New technology harnessing ocean energy

content.title: The global phenomenon swallowing whole neighbourhoods
content.description: Giant ravines: Entire communities are disappearing because of an extreme form of soil erosion.

blocks.altText: The global phenomenon swallowing neighbourhoods

content.title: The floating houses that are resilient to extreme weather
content.description: The floating houses built to withstand typhoons and flooding in the Philippines.

blocks.altText: The Philippines village floating on water

content.title: What it's like to camp in Antarctica
content.description: Marc Cieslak spends a night on ice, camping under the stars.

blocks.altText: Camping in sub-zero temperatures in Antarctica

content.title: Can these 3D-printed sea walls protect marine wildlife?
content.description: One team is on a mission to create 3D printed sea walls with environmental benefits.

blocks.altText: Can 3D-printed sea walls protect marine wildlife in Miami?

content.title: Alaska's melting glaciers that rip homes apart
content.description: Qasa Alom meets a team conducting research on Alaska's changing environment.

blocks.altText: A home falling into water

content.title: Inside the Icelandic plant turning CO2 into rocks
content.description: The world's largest direct air capture plant sucks CO2 from the air and deposits it underground.

blocks.altText: Inside the Icelandic plant turning CO2 into rocks

content.title: Nasa reveals giant lava lake on Jupiter's volcanic moon
content.description: New research suggests the fiery moon Io has been spewing lava for billions of years.

blocks.altText: Nasa reveals giant lava lake on Jupiter's volcanic moon

content.title: Why giant hailstones are on the rise
content.description: Although huge hailstones are still rare, there are signs that their frequency and size are increasing.

blocks.altText: A giant hailstone beside a softball

content.title: Listen to world's first 'chat' between humans and whales
content.description: Scientists had a conversation with Twain, the humpback whale. It's the first ever recorded chat of its kind.

blocks.altText: Listen to world's first 'chat' between humans and whales

content.title: England's 'largest gold nugget' discovered
content.description: A metal detectorist has uncovered something pretty unexpected and highly valuable on farmland in rural England.

blocks.altText: England's 'largest gold nugget' found

content.title: Photos from the deep sea show 'exciting' new species
content.description: Scientists exploring the ocean off the New Zealand coast believe they have discovered 100 new marine species.

blocks.altText: A potential new species of squid, discovered off the coast of New Zealand.

content.title: What 'zombie fires' are and why they pose a risk for Canada
content.description: Over 100 fires in one province alone have been burning under the Canadian snow at an unprecedented rate.

blocks.altText: Why 'zombie fires' threaten Canada

content.title: Mesmerising life in the deep sea
content.description: Explore depths where volcanic fluids meet near-freezing seawater, creating a dynamic clash below.

blocks.altText: Life in the deep sea

content.title: What happens when it rains space debris
content.description: A bus-sized satellite has become the latest piece to fall to Earth. How often does that happen?

blocks.altText: Bus approaching Earth

content.title: Why electric vehicles struggle in extreme cold
content.description: Freezing temperatures affect electric vehicles in two major ways. Watch to discover how and why.

blocks.altText: Why electric vehicles struggle in extreme cold

content.title: The spongy creatures cleaning Zanzibar's oceans
content.description: As ocean temperatures rise, women in Zanzibar turn to natural sea sponge farming to stay afloat.

blocks.altText: The spongy creatures cleaning Zanzibar's oceans

content.title: The race to fix clean energy's waste problem
content.description: While wind electricity is clean, this green industry has a waste problem. Now there's a race to solve it.

blocks.altText: How clean energy can cause unintended 'waste'

content.title: Residents describe 'eye-watering' landfill stench
content.description: The smell is so bad that locals cannot hang their washing out to dry, they said.

blocks.altText: A yellow construction vehicle is seen in the distance atop the hilly landfill site.

content.title: The snubbed Italian town that's now winning awards
content.description: Despite the world's obsession with Tuscany as a holiday destination, Grosseto seemed to have been left off the tourist map. However with its medieval centre and proximity to regional parks and beaches, it's now showing Italy how tourism can be done.

blocks.altText: Piazza Dante, Grosseto (Credit: Katie McKnoulty)

content.title: Animal wildlife charity announces membership drive
content.description: The Alderney Wildlife Trust said memberships will help fund conservation projects on the island.

blocks.altText: A seagull flying near some rocks

content.title: Small antelopes 'settle in' at Devon zoo
content.description: Dartmoor Zoo said a group of three male Kirk's dik-diks were settling in well to its African Aviary.

blocks.altText: Picture of a Kirk Dik Dik

content.description: Showcasing the best images sent to us from around Dorset.

blocks.altText: A wheelbarrow full of brightly-coloured flowers sits in a garden with a tree on the left and a fence on the right. It is bathed in sunshine.

content.description: Showcasing the best images sent to us from around Oxfordshire.

blocks.altText: A sunny shot of the canal under a bright blue sky with a red narrowboat towards the horizon and a grassy footpath on the left.

content.title: Pre-loved toy business partners with wildlife trust
content.description: Charlotte Liebling, from Leighton Buzzard, says the partnership is "beautifully aligned".

blocks.altText: A teddy bear next to a sign that reads "Saving the planet, one teddy at a time"
